Disciple of Change.name: Апостол Перемен
Disciple of Change.description: При получении мутации, бросьте два раза 1к100 и выберите ту, которая вам больше нравится.

Amorphous.name: Бесформенный
Amorphous.description: Существо представляет собой бесформенный сгусток. Существо получает только половину урона от атака, кроме огня, холода и магии. Существо игнорирует все Травмы и может быть уничтожено только когда его здоровье опустится до 0 в результате урона огнём, холодом или магией. Если урон до 0 здоровья имеет иную природу, существо переходит в состояние бездействия на r [[/r 1d10]] раундов , а затем восстанавливает 1 пункт Здоровья. Бесформенные существа избегают источников излишнего тепла или холода. .

Tzeentch's Blessing.name: Благословение Тзинча
Tzeentch's Blessing.description:
Тзинч, Бог магии Хаоса, одарил вас червячком-паразитом, поселившемся в голове. Когда вы приобретаете этот Талант, одно Заклинание свободно проскальзывает в ваш разум, поселяется там и звучит тихим шёпотом во сне. Заклинание можно выбрать из любой Школы магии.


После этого вы можете приобрести по одному заклинанию Цветной магии, ценой 100 очков опыта, за каждое запоминенное заклинание Тзинча.

Double Life.name: Двойная жизнь
Double Life.description: Вы настолько искусны в сохранении своего Альтер эго, что способны жить двумя абсолютно разными жизнями. Когда вы приобретаете этот талант, вы можете взять вторую Карьеру наравне с вашей Карьерой Хаоса. Теперь вы принадлежите одновременно обоим карьерам и можете совершать шаги развития и приобретать Таланты из обеих. Любые изменения карьеры по-прежнему требуют одобрения ведущего, чтобы лучшим образом соответствовать ходу кампании и отражать вашу двойную жизнь.

Ring of Opsianon.name: Кольцо Опсианона
Ring of Opsianon.description: Гидеон носит золотое кольцо с чёрным гранёным обсидианом.

Mark of Tzeentch.name: Метка Тзинча
Mark of Tzeentch.description: Тзинч, Повелитель Перемен, отметил это существо физическим клеймом, отметив его как важную фигуру в Великой игре. Это существо получает [[/r ceil(1d10/3)]]{1d10/3} Мутаций, чередующихся между Физическими и Ментальными. Все физические мутации должны быть определены броском по таблице мутаций Тзинча. Это существо получает @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.sYbgpSnRqSZWgwFP]{Этикет(Последователи Тзинча)}, и подвержено Враждебности по отношению к явным Нурглитам. Существо также испытывает Враждебность Нурглитов, если они могут видеть Метку Тзинча. Дополнительно существо может приобрести за обычную цену следующие таланты, как если-бы они были карьерными талантами: @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.1IZWRr7BYOIcqPlQ]{Эфирный унисон}, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.3O9clK7LGyuLTHPW]{Школа Магии(любая)}, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.hiU7vhBOVpVI8c7C]{Магия Хаоса(Тзинч)}, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.9sMAf0xmehjEmUao]{Быстрые руки}, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.BYChSVfMG004eflQ]{Безупречная дикция}, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.6w30u0VPsAicrqb5]{Магическое чутье}, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.mdPGZsn2396dEpOf]{Простейшая магия}, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.OEjUvJKi0xmBwbS2]{Второе зрение}, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.F2EiuAc6IpaGd4J7]{Боевой маг}, and @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.qdMbxW09FUoYBzmB]{Ведьма!}

Mindless.name: Неразумное
Mindless.description: Существо неразумно и живёт только своими природными инстинктами или магическим принуждением. Оно не имеет Инициативы, Интеллекта, Силы Воли и Харизмы и не может совершать проверку этих Характеристик. Для подсчёта Здоровья оно использует свой рейтинг Силы всякий раз, когда в обычно случае использовался бы Рейтинг Силы Воли. Посколько у него нет Инициативы, оно всегда совершает ход последним в Раунде.

Shapeshifter.name: Перевёртыш
Shapeshifter.description: Это существо может по желанию менять свой облик, оборачиваясь из человека в обозначенное Существо. Трансформация занимает полный Раунд, в течение которого оно не может совершить ни Движение, ни Действие. Когда луна Маннслиб полна, это существо должно пройти Заурядную (+20) проверку Силы Воли , чтобы избежать принудительной трансформации. Существа, приобретающие данную Черту, испытывают серьезные сложности с Проверкой Силы воли на первых порах (по усмотрению ведущего). При трансформации существо сохраняет свои ментальные атрибуты (Инт, СВ, и Х), но остальная часть его профиля становится профилем обозначенного Существа.

Blighted.name: Переносчик болезни
Blighted.description: Существо источает означенную болезнь, и передаёт её при контакте. При прикосновении пострадавший должен совершить Проверку Заражения, но проверка на 2 шага сложнее обычного. Если жертва заражается болезнью, её инкубационный период меняется на 'Отсутсвует'

Tzeentch's Fire.name: Пламя Тзинча
Tzeentch's Fire.description: Существо объято пламенем Тзинча’, слетающее с кончиков пальцев, вырывающееся из глаз и рта. Все существа одного типа (например Розовые или Голубые Ужасы), находящиеся поблизости, объединяют свою силу. Один Ужас выбирается в качестве средоточия(заклинателя) и может сотворить 1 заклинание Тзинча: Розовые ужасы произносят @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-eis.items.sklbZU3K8ogeu3mC]{Розовое пламя Тзинча}; другие существа произносят заклинание @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-eis.items.wY6JAt76eArBroYC]{Голубое пламя Тзинча} Spell. Каждое дополнительно участвующее в объединении сил существо добавляет +1 УУ, вплоть до максимума +9 УУ, в качестве Свободного действия.

Pneumonia.name: Пневмония
Pneumonia.description:
.

Персонаж с Пневмонией должен совершать Сложную (+0) проверку Стойкости каждый день, когда он испытывает неудобство, отправляясь в путешествие, участвуя в сражении или совершает другую физическую активность. Провал проверки приводит к тому что Лихорадка становится Серьезной. Пока действует Симптом @Symptom[Лихорадка(Серьезный)] проверку необходимо совершать каждый день, в противном же случае также развивается симптом @Symptom[Летальный исход].

Absorb.name: Поглощение
Absorb.description: В конце раунда, если существо имеет Преимущество больше, чем связанные с ним боем враги, оно поглощает одного противника равного размера или меньше. Поглощённая жертва получает состояния @Condition[Обездвижен] в количестве, равном Рейтингу Силы существа и считается находящейся @UUID[JournalEntry.t36Z4DOhYnfX1dr3]{В клинче}. Поглощённая жертва теряет Рейтинг Силы существа здоровья в конце каждого раунда; Броня и Рейтинг Выносливости не уменьшают этот урон. Существо исцеляется на то-же самое количество Здоровья. Если поглощённая жертва погибает, существо отступает, чтобы переварить поглощённое тело в течение следующих нескольких дней. Любая атака, поражающая существо, наносит такое-же количество урона поглощённой жертве.

Suffused with Magic.name: Полон магии
Suffused with Magic.description: Все заклинания, произнесенные в пределах Рейтинга СВ ярдов от вас, получаются +1 УУ к сотворению. Этот бонус можно получить только один раз за сотворение, независимо от того, сколько персонажей с талантом находится рядом.

Fleshthief.name: Похититель плоти
Fleshthief.description:
Существо, обладающее Чертой @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Демон}, может носить плоть любого убитого ею человека. Кроме того, оно может идеально имитировать личность жертвы, ставшей оболочкой, вкусе с имитацией голоса и манер. Для подготовки плоти требуется [[/r 1d10]] Раундов, после чего существо может носить и снимать её по желанию, это занимает 1 Раунд. После подготовки плоть сгниёт только в случае смерти носителя, но она может быть повреждена обычными средствами. Если существо пожелает, оно может вырваться из телесной оболочки, разорвав плоть и получив черту @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.kJNAY1YRaCy9IgmT]{Ужас} на один раунд. Плоть после этого использовать уже невозможно.


Знавшие того, чья плоть и личность была украдена, могут совершить Тщетную (-40) проверку Интуиции , чтобы увидеть что что-то не так, хотя и не будут точно знать что именно. .

Common Cold.name: Простуда
Common Cold.description:
Сезонная, как осенний листопад, простуда всё-же является вечным бичом Старого Света. Начинаясь с чихания и покашливания, она имеет все шансы усугубиться, если не попытаться это предотвратить. У каждого старика в Империи есть свой набор надёжнейших дедовских средств от простуды, а также несколько историй, как она проводила их друзей и близких в Сады Морра.

Персонажи с простудой, снова пострадав от непогоды в дождь или снегопад, продолжительность заболевания увеличивается на [[/r 1d10]] дней. Если персонаж более простудой больше 14 дней, она перерастает в Пневмонию.
Common Cold.contraction: If you fail a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test when exposed to the elements, or when an infected person sneezes or coughs in your immediate vicinity.

Purple Brain Fever.name: Пурпурный менингит
Purple Brain Fever.description: Пурпурный менингит - страшная болезнь. Голова раздувается до ужасающих размеров и сопровождается приступами лихорадки и бреда. Лицо приобретает ужасающий сливовый оттенок, глаза лезут из орбит, а язык распухает, занимая весь рот и даже больше. Смерть обычно наступает в течение недели.
Purple Brain Fever.contraction: If you fail an Average (+20) Endurance Test when physical contact is made with an infected individual (at a rate of 1 Test per hour of exposure).
Purple Brain Fever.symptoms: Blight, Convulsions, Delirium, Fever (Severe), Lingering (Challenging), Swelling (face and head).

Split.name: Разделение
Split.description: Если существо получает Травму, оно разделяется на две части и заменяется двумя @UUID[Actor.cLOGeMqUty61nYB9]{Голубыми ужасами}, которые полностью здоровы.

Animalistic Legs.name: Animalistic Legs
Animalistic Legs.description: +1 Movement; this mutation can only be hidden by clothing; Difficult (–10) Athletics Test to walk with a normal gait

Animalistic Psyche.name: Animalistic Psyche
Animalistic Psyche.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.AGcJl5rHjkyIQBPP]{Bestial} Creature Trait for [[/r 1d10]] hours if you fail a Test derived from Willpower

Beacon of Corruption.name: Beacon of Corruption
Beacon of Corruption.description: Whenever subject to Psychology, gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.xsGbDFqK2qh7lsIj]{Corruption} (Minor) Creature Trait

Beaked Face.name: Beaked Face
Beaked Face.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pLW9SVX0TVTYPiPv]{Bite} +3 Creature Trait; this mutation cannot be hidden

Bear Head.name: Bear Head
Bear Head.description: +1 Armour Point to the Head; Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pLW9SVX0TVTYPiPv]{Bite} +9 Creature Trait; this mutation cannot be hidden

Beast Head.name: Beast Head
Beast Head.description: Roll on the @Table[beasthead] Table; this mutation cannot be hidden

Bestial Face (Dog).name: Bestial Face (Dog)
Bestial Face (Dog).description:
You feel an irresistible urge to fall to your knees and howl. As your jaw is forced to its maximum extension, you begin to choke uncontrollably as a thickly furred snout forces its way through your face. Your Human nose, lips, and teeth slough off, nothing more than relics of your former existence, replaced by the snarling face of a dog.

Lose 20 Fellowship and 10 Intelligence. Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.9h82z72XGo9tfgQS]{Acute Sense (Smell)} Talent.

Beweaponed Extremities.name: Beweaponed Extremities
Beweaponed Extremities.description: Permanently reduce Dexterity to 0. You cannot be disarmed; this mutation cannot be hidden

Big Ears.name: Big Ears
Big Ears.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.9h82z72XGo9tfgQS]{Acute Sense} (Hearing) Talent; this mutation can only be hidden by clothing

Blank Face.name: Blank Face
Blank Face.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear} 2 Creature Trait; this mutation can only be hidden by clothing

Blast of Corruption (Tzeentch).name: Blast of Corruption (Tzeentch)
Blast of Corruption (Tzeentch).description:
You channel profane magic into an explosive blast of corruption. This is a magic missile with Damage +5 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect. Everyone affected by the spell must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain 1 Corruption.

Lore: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Школа: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Blast of Corruption (Undivided).name: Blast of Corruption (Undivided)
Blast of Corruption (Undivided).description: You channel profane magic into an explosive blast of corruption. This is a magic missile with Damage +5 that targets everyone in the Area of Effect. Everyone affected by the spell must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain 1 Corruption.

Blasted Mind.name: Blasted Mind
Blasted Mind.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.IAWyzDfC286a9MPz]{Immunity to Psychology} Creature Trait for [[/r 1d10]]  Rounds whenever you would take a @Condition[Broken] Condition, afterwards take [[/r 1d10]] Broken Conditions

Blue Fire of Tzeentch.name: Blue Fire of Tzeentch
Blue Fire of Tzeentch.description:
Your words conjure a writhing ball of coruscating blue fire that engulfs your foes. Blue Fire of Tzeentch is a magic missile. Anyone within your Initiative Bonus yards of the target suffers a +3 Damage hit, and gains +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition.

Should a Character of size small or larger be reduced to 0 Wounds by this spell, or while suffering from an Ablaze Condition from Blue Fire of Tzeentch, roll a [[/r 1d10]]. On a roll of 9, two @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-eis.actors.cLOGeMqUty61nYB9]{Blue Horror of Tzeentch} claw their way out of the Character’s screaming flesh, killing them in the process.

Lore: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Школа: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Boar Head.name: Boar Head
Boar Head.description: +1 Armour Point to the Head; @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.BqPZn6q3VHn9HUrW]{Horns (Tusks)} Creature Trait; this mutation cannot be hidden

Bolt of Change.name: Bolt of Change
Bolt of Change.description:
A pulsating bolt of scintillating Chaotic energy rends the air. Bolt of Change is a magic missile, and targets suffer a +7 Damage hit. Further, targets must make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test. A target that fails gains +1 Corruption Point. On a fumble, the target immediately rolls for a Mutation (@Table[expandedmutatemental]{Mental} or @Table[expandedmutatephys]{Physical}), and gains the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.hiU7vhBOVpVI8c7C]{Chaos Magic (Tzeentch)}  Talent. A Character affected by this spell may resist a mutation by spending a point of Resolve. 

Lore: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Школа: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Bolt of Corruption (Tzeentch).name: Bolt of Corruption (Tzeentch)
Bolt of Corruption (Tzeentch).description:
You channel dark magic into a damaging bolt of corrosive power. This is a magic missile with a Damage of +6. Targets affected by the spell must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain 1 Corruption.

Lore: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Школа: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Bolt of Corruption (Undivided).name: Bolt of Corruption (Undivided)
Bolt of Corruption (Undivided).description: You channel dark magic into a damaging bolt of corrosive power. This is a magic missile with a Damage of +6. Targets affected by the spell must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain 1 Corruption.

Boon of Tzeentch.name: Boon of Tzeentch
Boon of Tzeentch.description:
Your words, imbued with the labyrinthine prescience of the Changer of the Ways, twist your mind, granting you access to new arcane knowledge. Choose one Spell from any Lore (to ensure swift play, the GM may impose a nine second time limit). While Boon of Tzeentch is in effect, you may cast your new Spell as if you had memorised it, but may not record it in a Grimoire, Scroll, or similar. If you channel to cast the new Spell, you may use either Channelling (Dhar) or the Channelling Skill appropriate to the Lore the spell normally requires, should you possess it.

If you suffer a miscast when channelling or casting this new Spell, the Boon of Tzeentch Spell quits your mind in disgust, and also erases itself from your grimoire should it have allowed itself to be recorded there.

Lore: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Школа: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Bulging Eyes.name: Bulging Eyes
Bulging Eyes.description: +10 Initiative; this mutation can only be hidden by clothing

Bull Head.name: Bull Head
Bull Head.description: +1 Armour Point to the Head; gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.BqPZn6q3VHn9HUrW]{Horns} Creature Trait; this mutation cannot be hidden

Burning Skin.name: Burning Skin
Burning Skin.description: Creatures and objects that physically touch you must pass an Athletics Test or gain 1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition; this mutation cannot be hidden

Carapace.name: Carapace
Carapace.description: +1 Armour Point on two random Hit Locations; this mutation can only be hidden by clothing

Claws.name: Claws
Claws.description: Hands count as a Creature @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.AtpAudHA4ybXVlWM]{Weapon} of Damage equal to your SB; this mutation cannot be hidden

Cloud of Flies.name: Cloud of Flies
Cloud of Flies.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait; this mutation cannot be hidden

Crested Head.name: Crested Head

Curse of Tzeentch.name: Curse of Tzeentch
Curse of Tzeentch.description:
Tzeentchian Lore has it that all spells ultimately derive from the God’s will, and so belong to him. Using this spell, a Tzeentch sorcerer can cause another wizard to lose the knowledge and ability to cast a spell they previously had mastery of.

Should the curse of Tzeentch be successfully cast, the caster must then make an opposed Willpower Test against the target. If the caster wins, the target loses access to a randomly selected spell. The effects of the spell lasts for one day for every level of success scored by the caster during the opposed test.

Lore: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Demonic Mien (Tzeentch).name: Demonic Mien (Tzeentch)
Demonic Mien (Tzeentch).description:
You channel the transformative power of Chaos into your own flesh, temporarily sacrificing your mortal form on the altar of your god’s will. Your body is warped, assuming aspects of a Daemon loyal to your patron god. Roll on the @Table[demonic-mien] table, and apply the relevant Trait for the duration of the spell. For every +2 SL you may both extend the duration and roll again on the table. Should you roll the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.v3uzEthcq0JRar0J]{Daemonic} Trait and be reduced to 0 Wounds, your soul is sucked into the Realms of Chaos as described in the Creature Traits rules.

Foul Messenger (Tzeentch).name: Foul Messenger (Tzeentch)
Foul Messenger (Tzeentch).description:
You conjure forth a swarm of minor daemons shackled to  your will. The form of the daemons will vary depending on your deity. The daemons will bear a short message (approximately 25 words) to your target. They travel almost instantaneously, and are invisible (and inaudible) to anyone without the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.OEjUvJKi0xmBwbS2]{Second Sight} Talent even while delivering their message. Anyone with the Talent may make a Hard (–20) Perception Test to notice the swarm, and hear their message. For every +2 SLs, you may double the length of the message.

Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Joyous Aspect (Tzeentch).name: Joyous Aspect (Tzeentch)
Joyous Aspect (Tzeentch).description:
The caster infuses the target (perhaps themselves) with a corrupted caul of Dhar-infused Ulgu, sheathing them in an aura of concealment. While the spell is in force, the target appears without flaw, or blemish. Scars, deformities and, most crucially, mutations are undetectable, save through Divine means. 

While obvious deformities are hidden, the targets can appear strange, or outlandish, infused with too much life, or unnaturally alluring. Passing a Hard (–20) Perception Test reveals something is awry, though not precisely what. For Characters with the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.OEjUvJKi0xmBwbS2]{Second Sight} Talent the Test is  Challenging (+0), and should they succeed they will become aware that a spell is in place, but not what it hides.

Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Master of Fortune.name: Master of Fortune
Master of Fortune.description:
Tzeentch sorcerers often bargain with their master to provide them with insights about their potential fate. Scrying in this manner is dangerous, for Tzeentch is a capricious god, even in the case of his own favoured servants. Once the spell is cast it may not be cast again until its duration has run out.

Determine the result of the Language (Magick) Test needed to cast the spell. For every positive SL the caster benefits from an a point of Fortune which they can use as normal for the duration of the spell. However, if the spell fails then for every negative level of success the caster receives a point of Corruption as they receive a dizzying array of disturbing future echoes.

Lore: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Mindfire.name: Mindfire
Mindfire.description:
The air warps around your fingertips, forming a bolt of shimmering, hazy magical energy that can be hurled at your target. Anyone affected by Mindfire must make a Challenging (+0) Cool Test, or gain 1 Corruption Point. For every +2 SL, you may make one target gain an additional Corruption Point if the Cool Test is failed. Should a Mutation occur as a result of this Spell, the target automatically rolls on the @Table[expandedmutatemental] table, and gains +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition as unnatural fire spills from every orifice in their head.

Multiple Legs.description: +1 Movement; this mutation cannot be hidden

Obsession (Tzeentch).name: Obsession (Tzeentch)
Obsession (Tzeentch).description:
You must possess a beloved or precious object belonging to the target. You weave magic infused with the raw stuff of Chaos into the object that, in turn, affects the target. They become obsessed with something: the precise nature of the obsession depends onthe individual in question, and your Lore. For instance, when cast with the Lore of Nurgle, Obsession may cause a recently wounded target to become obsessed with picking at their scabs. The Lore of Slaanesh may cause an epicure or gourmand to overeat.


The target must pass an Average (+20) Endurance Test every hour, or succumb to their obsession. On a failure, future tests become Challenging (+0). Subsequent failings make Tests increasingly harder, until they become Very Hard (–30). Should the target ever Fumble one of these Tests (fail while rolling a double), the target becomes completely obsessed. They can do nothing except indulge the obsession, no matter the costs or implications, for [[/r d10]]–Will Power Bonus hours (minimum 1 hour). At the end of the spell’s duration, in addition to any other physical, social, or financial implications, the target must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain +1 Corruption Point.

A target may only ever be affected once by this spell once for each Lore with which it is cast. Any future attempts on the same target with this spell have no effect.

Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Pink Fire of Tzeentch.name: Pink Fire of Tzeentch
Pink Fire of Tzeentch.description:
Swirling bolts of pink fire arc from your outstretched fingertips, causing reality to scream in anguish. Pink Fire of Tzeentch is a magic missile. Targets affected suffer a +6 Damage hit, and gain +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition.

Should a Character of size Small or larger be reduced to 0 Wounds by this spell, or while suffering from an Ablaze Condition caused by Pink Fire of Tzeentch, roll a [[/r 1d10]]. On a roll of 9, a @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-eis.actors.iDy8SDTwJSlCzZMl]{Pink Horror} claws its way out of the target’s writhing corpse, killing the individual.

Power of Chaos (Tzeentch).name: Power of Chaos (Tzeentch)
Power of Chaos (Tzeentch).description:
You call on the Dark Gods of Chaos to aid your efforts by tearing a small rent to the aethyr. Any spells cast within Fellowship Bonus yards of the point targeted by the spell have their CN halved. Anyone within the AoE must pass an Average (+20) Endurance Test at the end of each Round or gain +1 Corruption Point. Anyone casting a spell within the AoE makes their Test at Average (+20) Difficulty.

Rearranged Face.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear} 1 Creature Trait; Characters trying to determine if you are lying suffer a -20 penalty to Intuition; this mutation can only be hidden by clothing

Rend Aethyr (Tzeentch).name: Rend Aethyr (Tzeentch)
Rend Aethyr (Tzeentch).description:
Your foul, profane words tear apart the fabric of reality, ripping a hole in the world, through which the servants of the Dark Gods are free to pour. A ragged portal to the aethyr appears.

At the end of every Round, one Lesser Daemon crosses from the Realms of Chaos through the portal. These Daemons are not under your control, but are likely to defend you and attack your enemies, should that be your unholy master’s will. The Daemons summoned depend on your Chaos Lore: @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.actors.8gG2Wim6wAlJWRax]{Daemonette of Slaanesh}, Plaguebearers of Nurgle, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-eis.actors.iDy8SDTwJSlCzZMl]{Horrors of Tzeentch}, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.actors.KZkuwdOYmE3nwB2n]{Bloodletter of Khorne}, and, for Sorcerers of Chaos Undivided, @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-eis.actors.piVHq2Y1a9PhHlZJ]{Furies of Chaos}. While the spell is in effect, any Daemons it summons are immune to the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.D0ImWEIMSDgElsnl]{Unstable} Condition.

For every +5 SL Overcast, you may increase the rate the Daemons arrive by +1.

Living creatures must pass an Average (+20) Endurance Test at the end of every Round where they can see the tear, or gain +1 Corruption. Any living creature foolish or unlucky enough to enter the rift falls into the Realms of Chaos and is immediately killed, unless a Fate point is spent. In that case, they are spat back into reality, perhaps saved by some power for an as of yet unfulfilled purpose.

Should you Fumble the casting of this spell, the Daemons crossing from the Realms of Chaos belong to a rival deity, and may well be immediately hostile to their summoner!

Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Any living creature foolish or unlucky enough to enter the rift falls into the Realms of Chaos and is immediately killed, unless a Fate point is spent. In that case, they are spat back into reality, perhaps saved by some power for an as of yet unfulfilled purpose.

Should you Fumble the casting of this spell, the Daemons crossing from the Realms of Chaos belong to a rival deity, and may well be immediately hostile to their summoner!

Lore: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Sense the Skein.name: Sense the Skein
Sense the Skein.description:
Your eyes glow pink and blue as you speak forbidden words of power. The scales fall from your eyes and you see, for a few fleeting moments, the interconnected fate of all things. You may choose one target you can see, and the GM must reveal the target’s Motivation, Short-Term Ambition, and Long-Term Ambition.

Targets affected by a Spell from the Lore of Tzeentch must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption Point. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Shifting Colours.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.MVI0lXcg6vvtooAF]{Distracting} Creature Trait; this mutation cannot be hidden

Short Legs.name: Short Legs
Short Legs.description: -1 Movement; this mutation cannot be hidden

Skull Face.name: Skull Face
Skull Face.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear} 2 Creature Trait; this mutation can only be hidden by clothing

Slave to Darkness (Tzeentch).name: Slave to Darkness (Tzeentch)
Slave to Darkness (Tzeentch).description:
You implore your patron to take the soul of your target, replacing it with something terrible. Make an Opposed Willpower Test, which you must win by at least 2+ SL. Should you do this, the victim’s soul is sent howling into the Realms of Chaos, and the remaining body is possessed by a Daemon. Unless the target spends a Fate point, control of the Character is passed to the GM. Should you not win the  Test by at least 2+ SL, you instead suffer a @Table[majormis], and the spell fails. Should you Fumble the Test, you are punished by your god for your arrogance. Your soul is torn from your body, never to return unless you spend a Fate point to resist this, although your patron is unlikely to be pleased if you flagrantly reject their authority in such a fashion.

Given the risks and limitations inherent in this spell, it is generally cast on victims that have been ‘prepared’ for their sacrifice; they have been bound, drugged, and/or otherwise pacified.

Snake Head.description: +1 Armour Point to the Head; gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pLW9SVX0TVTYPiPv]{Bite} +3 and @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.gFkRm9wS65qe18Xv]{Venom (Average)} Creature Traits; this mutation cannot be hidden

Soul Sickness.description: Gain the @Symptom[Convulsions] Symptom for [[/r 1d10]] hours if you fail a Test derived from Willpower

Spiked Skin.description: Cannot waer armour; +1 Armour Points on all locations; gain a Free Attack (@UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.AtpAudHA4ybXVlWM]{Weapon} +4 Creature Trait) when Charging; this mutation cannot be hidden

The Flickering Flames of Fickle Fate.name: The Flickering Flames of Fickle Fate
The Flickering Flames of Fickle Fate.description:
You conjure forth a torrent of magical fire, which spits, crackles and burns without material fuel. The fire has no physical properties and does not burn, damage, or emit heat. All living creatures and Daemons who can see the fire may choose to reroll every Test once, as if they had spent a Fortune Point, even if they passed the Test. Each time they do so, they must then pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain +1 Corruption Point (@Corruption[minor]{Minor}). Characters bearing the Mark of Tzeentch are immune to this Corruption. The Test to resist gaining Corruption may not be rerolled using this Spell’s effect.

Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

The Purple Hand.name: The Purple Hand
The Purple Hand.description:
This spell is a petty curse used by Purple Hand sorcerers  to intimidate and cajole truculent co-conspirators. Of all the non-verbal codes used by the Purple Hand the meaning of this curse is clear: mend your ways immediately or face punishment.

In order to cast the spell the sorcerer must first acquire a small amount of matter from their target: a loose hair or toenail clipping will serve. Should this item be acquired and the spell successfully cast, the palms of the target’s hands turn a deep purple. The spell’s effects last for one hour for every level of success scored by the caster while casting the spell.

Thorny Scales.description: +1 Armour Points to all locations; this mutation can only be hidden by clothing

Three Eyes.name: Three Eyes
Three Eyes.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.9h82z72XGo9tfgQS]{Acute Sense} (Vision) Talent; this mutation can only be hidden by clothing

Transformation of Tzeentch.name: Transformation of Tzeentch
Transformation of Tzeentch.description:
At your command, bonds of aethyric fire coil from the earth, enshrouding your target in a cocoon of magical energy. Targets affected gain the @Condition[Prone] Condition, and are considered Helpless for the duration of the Spell. When Transformation of Tzeentch ends, the target must make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test, opposed by your Language (Magick) Skill. If they lose, they gain +1 Corruption Point, +1 extra Point for every SL by which they lost.

Lore: Targets of Spells from the Lore of Tzeentch are riven by the transformative magic of Chaos. Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Transparent Skin.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pTorrE0l3VybAbtn]{Fear} 2 Creature Trait; this mutation cannot be hidden

Two Heads.name: Two Heads
Two Heads.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.IFKWu98qmWpaSfUi]{Ambidextrous} Talent; this mutation cannot be hidden

Tzeentch's Firestorm.name: Tzeentch's Firestorm
Tzeentch's Firestorm.description:
A swirling storm of purple arcane fire bursts forth, summoned by your profane cackling. Tzeentch’s Firestorm is a magic missile. Everyone within Initiative Bonus yards of the target suffers a +9 Damage hit, and gains +1 @Condition[Ablaze] Condition.


Should a Character of size small or larger be reduced to 0 Wounds by this Spell, or while suffering from an Ablaze Condition caused by Tzeentch’s Firestorm, roll a [[/r 1d10]]. On a roll of 9, two @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-eis.actors.iDy8SDTwJSlCzZMl]{Pink Horrors} claw their way out of the target’s magically burning corpse, killing the poor unfortunate.

Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.

Tzeentch's Golden Aura.name: Tzeentch's Golden Aura
Tzeentch's Golden Aura.description:
This is one of the most straightforward and practical spells in a Tzeentch sorcerer’s arsenal. A swirling vortex of yellow fire is summoned out of the aethyr and wraps about the caster’s body, shielding them from incoming blows and missiles. Whilst the spell is in effect, the caster benefits from the Creature Trait @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.Bvd2aZ0gQUXHfCTh]{Ward 9+} .

Uneven Horns.description: +1 Armour Points to the Head; counts as a Creature @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.AtpAudHA4ybXVlWM]{Weapon} of Damage equal to your SB; this mutation cannot be hidden

Unusual Skin.description: Odd colour or texture: orange, striped, spotted, warty, etc.; this mutation cannot be hidden

Weeping Pus.name: Weeping Pus
Weeping Pus.description: Roll on the @Table[hitloc] table to twice to see where

Whiskered Snout.name: Whiskered Snout

Wings.description: Gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.EO05HX7jql0g605A]{Flight} 60 Creature Trait; this mutation can only be hidden by clothing

Wolf Head.description: +1 Armour Point to the Head; gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.pLW9SVX0TVTYPiPv]{Bite} +6 Creature Trait; gain the @UUID[Compendium.wfrp4e-core.items.9h82z72XGo9tfgQS]{Acute Sense (Smell)} Talent; this mutation cannot be hidden

Word of Tzeentch.name: Word of Tzeentch
Word of Tzeentch.description:
As your tongue forms the twisted sound-patterns of this blasphemous Spell, two voices seem to utter from your throat, in unholy and unnatural harmony with each other. Your words carry extra meaning for those affected by the Spell, though targets can never remember what was said. They are left with a haunting sense of foreboding, as if they have forgotten something very important about their own future.


Living targets affected by the Spell must make an Opposed Intelligence Test with you. If the target loses, they gain 1 @Condition[Stunned] Condition, +1 additional Stunned Condition for each SL by which they lost. If they Fumble, they gain the @Condition[Unconscious] Condition, and +1 Corruption.

Once all Conditions have been removed, targets affected must pass an Average (+20) Endurance Test, or gain +1 Corruption. Should they Fumble, they immediately gain 1 @Table[expandedmutatemental]{Mental Mutation}, and may not take a Short-term Ambition for the next [[/r 1d10]] weeks.

Should they pass their Test, they instead gain +1 Fortune Point, which can be used as normal. Such are the whims of Tzeentch.
